title: 2 Chronicles Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of 2 Chronicles with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 36 chapters.

questions.question: Who was the king of Judah when 2 Chronicles 36 begins?
questions.explanation: Jehoahaz was made king by the people after Josiah's death, as stated in 2 Chronicles 36:1.

questions.question: How long did Jehoahaz reign as king of Judah?
questions.explanation: Jehoahaz reigned for only three months before Pharaoh Neco deposed him, as recorded in 2 Chronicles 36:2.

questions.question: Who did Pharaoh Neco make king of Judah after deposing Jehoahaz?
questions.explanation: Pharaoh Neco set Jehoiakim, Jehoahaz's brother, as king over Judah, as per 2 Chronicles 36:4.

questions.question: What did Jehoiakim do that was evil in the sight of the LORD?
questions.explanation: Jehoiakim did evil by building high places, worshiping other gods, and rebelling against Pharaoh, as in 2 Chronicles 36:5-7.

questions.question: Who was king of Judah when the Babylonians first attacked Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: Jehoiakim was king when Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon came up against Jerusalem, 2 Chronicles 36:6.

questions.question: What tribute did Jehoiakim pay to Nebuchadnezzar?
questions.explanation: Jehoiakim paid tribute of silver and gold to the king of Babylon, 2 Chronicles 36:7.

questions.question: What happened to Jehoiakim after he rebelled against Nebuchadnezzar?
questions.explanation: Jehoiakim died and was buried, though not in the sepulchers of the kings, 2 Chronicles 36:9.

questions.question: Who succeeded Jehoiakim as king of Judah?
questions.explanation: Jehoiachin, also called Coniah, succeeded Jehoiakim as king, 2 Chronicles 36:9.

questions.question: How long did Jehoiachin reign in Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: Jehoiachin reigned for three months before being taken captive to Babylon, 2 Chronicles 36:9.

questions.question: Who took Jehoiachin captive to Babylon?
questions.explanation: Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took Jehoiachin captive, 2 Chronicles 36:10.

questions.question: Who was made king of Judah after Jehoiachin was taken to Babylon?
questions.explanation: Nebuchadnezzar set Zedekiah, Jehoiachin's uncle, as king over Judah, 2 Chronicles 36:10.

questions.question: What did Zedekiah do that was evil before the LORD?
questions.explanation: Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon, doing evil in God's sight, 2 Chronicles 36:12.

questions.question: What was the consequence of Zedekiah's rebellion against Babylon?
questions.explanation: Because of Zedekiah's rebellion, Jerusalem was destroyed, the people exiled, and his sons killed, 2 Chronicles 36:17-20.

questions.question: How long did the Babylonian captivity last according to 2 Chronicles 36?
questions.explanation: The captivity lasted seventy years as prophesied, 2 Chronicles 36:21.

questions.question: Who allowed the Israelites to return from Babylonian captivity?
questions.explanation: Cyrus the king of Persia issued a decree allowing the Israelites to return, 2 Chronicles 36:22-23.

questions.question: What did Cyrus command regarding the house of God in Jerusalem?
options: It should be left in ruins
It should be moved to Babylon
questions.explanation: Cyrus commanded the rebuilding of the house of God in Jerusalem, 2 Chronicles 36:23.

questions.question: True or False: Josiah was the father of Jehoahaz.
questions.explanation: Josiah was the father of Jehoahaz as stated in 2 Chronicles 36:1.

questions.question: True or False: Jehoiakim was taken captive to Babylon.
questions.explanation: Jehoiakim died and was buried, but he was not taken captive, 2 Chronicles 36:9.

questions.question: True or False: Zedekiah's sons were killed before his eyes by the Babylonians.
questions.explanation: Zedekiah saw his sons killed before he was blinded, 2 Chronicles 36:17.

questions.question: True or False: The people of Judah were exiled to Egypt after the fall of Jerusalem.
questions.explanation: They were exiled to Babylon, not Egypt, 2 Chronicles 36:20.

questions.question: True or False: The temple of the LORD was burned by the Babylonians.
questions.explanation: The Babylonians burned the house of God and broke down the walls, 2 Chronicles 36:19.

questions.question: True or False: The captivity was intended to fulfill the word of the LORD by Jeremiah.
questions.explanation: The exile fulfilled the word of the LORD by Jeremiah, 2 Chronicles 36:21.

questions.question: True or False: Cyrus commanded the rebuilding of the city walls but not the temple.
questions.explanation: Cyrus commanded the rebuilding of the temple, not specifically the city walls, 2 Chronicles 36:23.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "And in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of the LORD by the mouth of Jeremiah might be fulfilled, the LORD stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, that he made a proclamation..."
options: to make a house for the LORD God of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: to make a house for the LORD God of Israel
questions.explanation: Cyrus proclaimed to rebuild the house of the LORD God of Israel, 2 Chronicles 36:23.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "But they mocked the messengers of God, and despised his words, and misused his prophets, until the wrath of the LORD arose against his people..."
questions.explanation: The people mocked God's messengers until there was no remedy, 2 Chronicles 36:16.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "For the LORD God of their fathers sent to them by his messengers, rising up betimes, and sending; because he had compassion on his people, and on his dwelling place:"
questions.explanation: Despite God's compassion and sending messengers, the people mocked them, 2 Chronicles 36:15-16.

questions.question: Complete this verse: "And those who escaped from the sword carried away captive to Babylon, where they were servants to him and his sons until the reign of the kingdom of Persia:"
options: To fulfill the word of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: To fulfill the word of the LORD
questions.explanation: Their captivity fulfilled the word of the LORD spoken by Jeremiah, 2 Chronicles 36:20-21.

questions.question: What did the people of Judah do that provoked the LORD to wrath during the reigns of Jehoiakim and Zedekiah?
options: They sacrificed to idols and walked in their own ways
They destroyed the altar of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: They sacrificed to idols and walked in their own ways
questions.explanation: The people forsook the LORD and served idols, provoking His wrath, 2 Chronicles 36:14.

questions.question: How did the LORD respond to the continued disobedience of Judah?
options: He sent prophets to warn them
He allowed foreign nations to conquer them
He brought famine, sword, and pestilence
questions.explanation: God sent prophets and allowed calamities to come upon Judah, 2 Chronicles 36:15-17.

questions.question: Who was the last king of Judah before the Babylonian captivity?
questions.explanation: Zedekiah was the last king of Judah before captivity, 2 Chronicles 36:10-17.

questions.question: What did Nebuchadnezzar do to the walls of Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: Nebuchadnezzar broke down the walls of Jerusalem, 2 Chronicles 36:19.

questions.question: How did the people respond to the warnings of God's messengers?
options: They built altars to the LORD
questions.explanation: The people mocked and despised the prophets sent by God, 2 Chronicles 36:16.

questions.question: What was the fate of the temple treasures during the Babylonian invasion?
questions.explanation: The treasures of the temple were carried away to Babylon, 2 Chronicles 36:18.

questions.question: What was the purpose behind Cyrus' decree to rebuild the temple?
options: To gain favor with the Jews
questions.explanation: Cyrus' decree fulfilled the word of the LORD by Jeremiah, 2 Chronicles 36:22.

questions.question: How did the LORD stir up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia?
questions.explanation: The LORD stirred Cyrus to proclaim the rebuilding of the temple, 2 Chronicles 36:23.

questions.question: Which king of Judah was taken captive to Babylon along with his mother and servants?
questions.explanation: Jehoiachin was taken captive along with his mother and servants, 2 Chronicles 36:10.

questions.question: True or False: The LORD sent messengers early and often to warn Judah.
questions.explanation: God sent messengers rising up early and often to warn His people, 2 Chronicles 36:15.

questions.question: True or False: The people of Judah listened carefully and changed their ways when warned by the prophets.
questions.explanation: They mocked and despised the prophets, ignoring the warnings, 2 Chronicles 36:16.

questions.question: True or False: The captivity of Judah was a direct punishment for their sins.
questions.explanation: The captivity was a punishment for their disobedience and idolatry, 2 Chronicles 36:16-17.

questions.question: True or False: The walls of Jerusalem remained intact after the Babylonian siege.
questions.explanation: The walls were broken down by the Babylonians, 2 Chronicles 36:19.
